channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Sick of jobs lacking purpose? This Perl job literally cures the worldâ€™s ills
item.description: The company is looking for modern Perl developers with a strong interest in Python. You wonâ€™t just be showing off your skills, youâ€™ll be able to expand and build upon them too. Fancy putting your good genes to use in one of Englandâ€™s smartest, most beautiful cities? Want a role that has a tremendously positive impact on society? Get in touch, and letâ€™s get you making a difference.

item.title: Revolutionize and Democratize the Job Recruitment Game
item.description: An Irvine, California-based software company is looking for developers to help revolutionize and democratize the job recruitment game. If youâ€™re proficient in Perl and enthusiastic about other platforms, such as React or Angular on front-end and Node.js or Python on backend, this could be your opportunity to streamline the job market by helping recruiters make better decisions about candidates.

item.title: Front-end focus for a full stack Perl developer
item.description: If youâ€™re a full stack developer whose interest leans more towards front-end work, this role is a great opportunity for you to sharpen and deepen your front-end skills while still keeping your toes in the back-end world of Perl.

item.title: Put your Perl skills into action in a young, green city that leaves more greenbacks in your pocket.
item.description: Youâ€™ll be working for a Pittsburgh-based hosting company, well-known and well-respected within Perl circles. Serving over 120 countries worldwide and with their skin in the game for a quarter century, youâ€™ll be joining a squad with a smorgasbord of coding talent helping a plethora of businesses at scale.

item.title: When your Day Job is a Walk in the Park
item.description: If your vision board has â€œCTOâ€ smack-dab in the middle, then this role is your natural next move. In this hands-on role, youâ€™ll delve further into the wonderful world of team leadership. Youâ€™ll have the chance to gain experience with Go/Go-lang, develop your managerial chops, and did we mention lakeside lunchtime picnics? You bring the tea and sandwiches; weâ€™ll take care of the lake.

item.description: Laurent is unmatchable in his analysis of challenges. He is great in presenting result of his analysis. At the end it looks so simple and easy.

item.description: I have noticed one thing in Choroba's solution is that he always go for CPAN module if available otherwise he creates one. It makes the final solution just few lines of code.

item.title: Leaving irc.perl.org
item.description: I left IRC, and specifically irc.perl.org so long ago, that I did not even know sungo was the (only) administrator. Apparently he also threw in the towel now.

item.title: Net::Stripe
item.description: On September 14, there will be some big changes to the way that online payments work in Europe. Unfortunately we aren't 100% sure what they are! This is a thread for tracking new requirements of Net::Stripe

item.title: Get affordable premium wall, floor and window custom decals at StickerYou.com
item.description: StickerYou is not only king of stickers and labels, we do large-format decals too! Brand your office, store or event with high-quality, custom decals. Leave a lasting mark when your clients walk in - they'll know you mean business. StickerYou.com allows you to order decals in any size, shape and quantity. What are you waiting for? Get your office or store redesigned in an incredibly affordable way with StickerYou.com! Use code PERL10 at checkout for an exclusive Perl Weekly discount.

item.title: #415 - PWC
item.description:
Hi there,

So the Perl Weekly Challenge - has an awesome impact. It encouraged a number of people who have never blogged anything about Perl, to publish articles week by week. It brought out some of the old-timers from their caves. It even managed to get Damian Conway to write more frequently. It is clearly the project with the biggest positive impact on the Perl community in recent years.

Check out the web-site to get more information and also to read about Mohammad S. Anwar, the man behind the PWC. How he got into programming

Enjoy your week!
